body:
I am not even close to a good developer, and C++ is my main language. It is not difficult. The transition from Java to C++ was easy and I'm not seeing what's "so hard to understand" about C++. Actually I think it's much easier to use than a lot of the so-called "beginner" languages such as *JavaScript*, which you pretty much have to be a fucking expert in to do even the simplest things >:(. But most people think C/C++ are so hard that they're afraid of them, and that they are to be avoided if at all possible! While the latter has a large standard library, on their own they're both fairly straightforward and self-explanatory languages, not unlike Java, C#, or Python, in fact they have less layers of abstraction than those which usually makes them even less complicated. I don't see what's so hard about that. What part of C/C++ is so difficult compared to other languages?

Of course I'm not saying you should always use C/C++ for everything when certain things can indeed be done better in another language. Sometimes the extra functionality of higher level languages is very useful. But I don't see how that makes C/C++ *hard*, just not the proper choice for everything as is the case with all languages.
body_html:
I am not even close to a good developer, and C++ is my main language. It is not difficult. The transition from Java to C++ was easy and I'm not seeing what's "so hard to understand" about C++. Actually I think it's much easier to use than a lot of the so-called "beginner" languages such as JavaScript, which you pretty much have to be a fucking expert in to do even the simplest things >:(. But most people think C/C++ are so hard that they're afraid of them, and that they are to be avoided if at all possible! While the latter has a large standard library, on their own they're both fairly straightforward and self-explanatory languages, not unlike Java, C#, or Python, in fact they have less layers of abstraction than those which usually makes them even less complicated. I don't see what's so hard about that. What part of C/C++ is so difficult compared to other languages?

Of course I'm not saying you should always use C/C++ for everything when certain things can indeed be done better in another language. Sometimes the extra functionality of higher level languages is very useful. But I don't see how that makes C/C++ hard, just not the proper choice for everything as is the case with all languages.

body:
A few days ago I made some posts about having trouble accomplishing anything. I think I figured out ADHD and Imposter Syndrome as issues, but have been missing the elephant in the room.

For about a decade now I've been experiencing this huge mental block that I think might actually be at the heart of why I can't get anything done. Since then I have been seriously lacking in any creative ability whatsoever, nothing just comes to me anymore like it used to. However, for some reason I have retained the desire to do my usual things, despite having lost the ability. So I resort to thinking too hard about how to do something, and it just doesn't work without getting into the flow of it. This always bothered me, because it made the experience much more frustrating, and the results were never great. It becomes even worse when I see others succeeding in exactly all the things I want to do, and so easily. I think what it all comes down to is that I have this mental block and they do not, so things still just come to them naturally.

This came on pretty much suddenly one day, which is why I don't agree with people who say it's depression. It also did not make me feel depressed at all, in fact sadness actually became *less* intense for me afterwards, probably due to the right side of my brain practically shutting off. The first sign of trouble was that everything seemed noticeably more bland and frustrating than before. I chalked it up to having a bad couple of days and figured things would return to normal, but as time went on this did not change. I did not notice this then, but looking back now this is also about the time that I became very bad at finishing anything properly, instead it always resulted in a huge mess of a project that was only half-finished. At around the same time, new ideas stopped popping into my head too, whereas before it was pretty much overflowing. I used to come up with so many bizarre stories and could not stop, and now I can't even if I try. Finally, I no longer had a "taste" in anything, that is making my creations attractive, enjoyable, and complete (for me more than anyone else), they're now just a forced together, unfinished, unattractive mess. I didn't have to think about stuff much before this, I just was able to do it like the others I've been talking about being so much better than me. And now I can't, I have to "force" it and that never works. My whole state of mind is completely different now. If it matters, I was going through puberty at the time this occurred.

I've heard stories of things like writers block before and this seems like it but on a massive scale with every kind of subject. It kills me in programming, storytelling, art, math, science, music, humor, wording things, Minecraft, even making posts on reddit/ruqqus! It's very frustrating and has been going on for about a decade now with no end in sight. I can live with it but I'd *really* prefer a solution if there is one because I am not someone who likes to be bored and doing nothing all the time. I remember what it's like to always be doing so many interesting things which is probably why I still want to despite now lacking the ability. Any ideas on what to do about this gigantic mental block?
body_html:
A few days ago I made some posts about having trouble accomplishing anything. I think I figured out ADHD and Imposter Syndrome as issues, but have been missing the elephant in the room.

For about a decade now I've been experiencing this huge mental block that I think might actually be at the heart of why I can't get anything done. Since then I have been seriously lacking in any creative ability whatsoever, nothing just comes to me anymore like it used to. However, for some reason I have retained the desire to do my usual things, despite having lost the ability. So I resort to thinking too hard about how to do something, and it just doesn't work without getting into the flow of it. This always bothered me, because it made the experience much more frustrating, and the results were never great. It becomes even worse when I see others succeeding in exactly all the things I want to do, and so easily. I think what it all comes down to is that I have this mental block and they do not, so things still just come to them naturally.

This came on pretty much suddenly one day, which is why I don't agree with people who say it's depression. It also did not make me feel depressed at all, in fact sadness actually became less intense for me afterwards, probably due to the right side of my brain practically shutting off. The first sign of trouble was that everything seemed noticeably more bland and frustrating than before. I chalked it up to having a bad couple of days and figured things would return to normal, but as time went on this did not change. I did not notice this then, but looking back now this is also about the time that I became very bad at finishing anything properly, instead it always resulted in a huge mess of a project that was only half-finished. At around the same time, new ideas stopped popping into my head too, whereas before it was pretty much overflowing. I used to come up with so many bizarre stories and could not stop, and now I can't even if I try. Finally, I no longer had a "taste" in anything, that is making my creations attractive, enjoyable, and complete (for me more than anyone else), they're now just a forced together, unfinished, unattractive mess. I didn't have to think about stuff much before this, I just was able to do it like the others I've been talking about being so much better than me. And now I can't, I have to "force" it and that never works. My whole state of mind is completely different now. If it matters, I was going through puberty at the time this occurred.

I remember what it's like to always be doing so many interesting things which is probably why I still want to despite now lacking the ability. Any ideas on what to do about this gigantic mental block?

body:
If you try making a reply to another comment, it won't show up on your profile or the thread. It can only be accessed by clicking the direct permalink of the comment it was replied to, and the reply comment has no permalink (it just reloads the current page).

Also, if you got a reply to one of your comments in your inbox, it will create a notification, but since it's broken it'll cause you to get a 500 error when trying to access the page.

This should be fixed soon. In the meantime, if you're wondering why your inbox is broken and why your comments are missing, this is why.

Edit: this is now fixed!
body_html:
If you try making a reply to another comment, it won't show up on your profile or the thread. It can only be accessed by clicking the direct permalink of the comment it was replied to, and the reply comment has no permalink (it just reloads the current page).

Also, if you got a reply to one of your comments in your inbox, it will create a notification, but since it's broken it'll cause you to get a 500 error when trying to access the page.

This should be fixed soon. In the meantime, if you're wondering why your inbox is broken and why your comments are missing, this is why.

Edit: this is now fixed!

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

body: On almost every website I have encountered, conservatives are described as supporting economic freedom but restrictions on personal freedom, and liberals as favoring economic restrictions but supporting personal freedoms. I don't think either definition is correct, but the most astounding one to me is the idea that liberals believe in personal freedom. I don't know about you, but I don't think banning free speech, banning guns, compelling special treatment of certain groups, having insane amounts of laws, banning certain religions and beliefs, and a totalitarian government sound much like personal freedom. This also leads to libertarians being described as economically conservative and socially liberal, which makes no sense and is actually descriptive of neoliberals instead. Anyone know what led to this classification?
body_html: On almost every website I have encountered, conservatives are described as supporting economic freedom but restrictions on personal freedom, and liberals as favoring economic restrictions but supporting personal freedoms. I don't think either definition is correct, but the most astounding one to me is the idea that liberals believe in personal freedom. I don't know about you, but I don't think banning free speech, banning guns, compelling special treatment of certain groups, having insane amounts of laws, banning certain religions and beliefs, and a totalitarian government sound much like personal freedom. This also leads to libertarians being described as economically conservative and socially liberal, which makes no sense and is actually descriptive of neoliberals instead. Anyone know what led to this classification?

body:
In C, the `restrict` keyword (and others such as `__restrict` by compiler extensions) indicates that a pointer doesn't alias with another, and as such it doesn't have to reload the value from memory every single time it's referenced.

However, given that having aliasing/overlapping pointers is quite rare, I find myself marking nearly every pointer with `__restrict`. Instead, why not just have the restrict behavior by default, and an "unrestrict" qualifier in case pointers could alias? Better yet, specify *which* pointer(s) it could alias with, so they only have to reload the values with respect to each other?
body_html:
In C, the restrict keyword (and others such as __restrict by compiler extensions) indicates that a pointer doesn't alias with another, and as such it doesn't have to reload the value from memory every single time it's referenced.

However, given that having aliasing/overlapping pointers is quite rare, I find myself marking nearly every pointer with __restrict. Instead, why not just have the restrict behavior by default, and an "unrestrict" qualifier in case pointers could alias? Better yet, specify which pointer(s) it could alias with, so they only have to reload the values with respect to each other?

guild.description:
Laughing at the absurdity of society one post at a time. All political sides of the spectrum are welcome. Welcome to PoliticalHumor.
_____

#### Rules

_____

###### POSTS MUST BE BOTH DIRECTLY POLITICAL AND HUMOROUS

Funny content that is NOT political belong here:

* +Memes
* +DankMemes
* +DarkHumorAndMemes (NSFW)

Political posts that are NOT humorous belong here:

* +News
* +OpposingViewpoints
* +Politics
* +World_Politics

If you are looking for ONLY political memes, go here:

* +PoliticalMemes

_____

###### MARK NSFW FOR

* Antisemitism
* Racism

_____

###### NO HARASSMENT OR THREATS OF VIOLENCE

* Do not harass your fellow users.
* Do not threaten with violence or plan to execute unlawful violent activity and do not encourage others to do so.

_____

###### NO SPAM

* Do not flood this guild with rule-breaking or off-topic content.

_____

###### If you encounter rule-breaking content, report and downvote it. For a more accurate rule guide, see the pinned Guide to Posting.
guild.description_html:
Laughing at the absurdity of society one post at a time. All political sides of the spectrum are welcome. Welcome to PoliticalHumor.

Rules

POSTS MUST BE BOTH DIRECTLY POLITICAL AND HUMOROUS

Funny content that is NOT political belong here:

  • +Memes
  • +DankMemes
  • +DarkHumorAndMemes (NSFW)

Political posts that are NOT humorous belong here:

  • +News
  • +OpposingViewpoints
  • +Politics
  • +World_Politics

If you are looking for ONLY political memes, go here:

  • +PoliticalMemes
MARK NSFW FOR
  • Antisemitism
  • Racism
NO HARASSMENT OR THREATS OF VIOLENCE
  • Do not harass your fellow users.
  • Do not threaten with violence or plan to execute unlawful violent activity and do not encourage others to do so.
NO SPAM
  • Do not flood this guild with rule-breaking or off-topic content.
If you encounter rule-breaking content, report and downvote it. For a more accurate rule guide, see the pinned Guide to Posting.
guild.name: PoliticalHumor
